searchDocs.title: GX+ Released!
searchDocs.content: GX+ has now released! Get it now! And check out the docs

searchDocs.title: What is GX+?​
searchDocs.content: GX+ is a replacement set of systems for Gen X buses, rewritten from the ground up to provide a more stable and feature-rich experience. GX+ is designed to be more user-friendly and easier to use than Gen X, while also providing more customization options for bus owners. Some notable changes include:   Enriched customization optionsImproved performance (using new roblox programming techniques)Improved UINew Features Plugin SupportIncan support standard for all lightsEngine Stay-On capabilitiesRed override capabilities   warning GX+ is only designed and tested to work with Gen X buses. It is not guaranteed to work with other buses at this time, however you may try and do so (which will take a lot of converting stuff since there is no plugin for other bus types). Support will not be provided.

searchDocs.title: Getting Started​
searchDocs.content: Get started by purchasing GX+   note Already have it? Retrieve it in the FleetPoint discord server!   Also, make sure to install the GX+ Migration Plugin   After that, head over to the setup guide to get started

searchDocs.title: How it works​
searchDocs.content: First, make a ticket in our discord server through the /ticket create command   note The availability of commissions is based on the current workload of the developers. If we are too busy, we may not be able to take on your commission. We will only work on up to 5 simple, 5 intermediate, and 3 advanced plugin commissions at a time. Check the product hub stock for commission availability.

searchDocs.title: Pricing​
searchDocs.content: Due to the complexity of plugins, we have a tiered pricing system based on the complexity of the plugin.   Tier	PriceSimple	500 Robux Intermediate	850 Robux Advanced	1200 Robux

searchDocs.title: Install a Plugin
searchDocs.content: Install a Plugin You can install a plugin by taking the module script, and just dropping it into the Plugins folder! Refer to the plugin developer's documentation for more information on how to setup the plugin. If you want to make a plugin, check out how to do that here. note Still need support? There's a support channel in our discord server. The plugins folder can be found in DriveSeat in your bus.

searchDocs.title: Migration
searchDocs.content: Migration Using the GX+ Migration Plugin, you can easily migrate your existing Gen X configuration to GX+ with just the click of a button note While GX+ migrates most of your configuration, some configuration opens, such as certain timings, may need to be manually converted over GX+ also comes with a lot more configuration options that will allow you to customize your experience even further, refer to the detailed configuration for more information

searchDocs.title: Downloading the model​
searchDocs.content: Make sure you have purchased GX+, and have access to the FleetPoint discord server. You can download the model via the /retrieve command from Parcel.

searchDocs.title: Installing the model​
searchDocs.content: Import the gxplus.rbxm file into Roblox Studio, and take a look inside the model.   All you need to do is copy what is inside the model into the DriveSeat of your bus.   note There is a special Instance in there named Roll; if your bus already includes it, you don't need to copy it over.   Next, open up your GX+ Migration Plugin. Select the bus model. If the OK text shows up in red, you did something incorrect.   Otherwise, select Migrate to GX+ and everything should be good to go!   Check the studio logs to see if there was an error with migrating to GX+. If there was, let us know in the support channel in our discord server.   Check out the configuration options next!   warning GX+ was tested primarily on stock Gen X buses. This means that heavily modified buses with extra features may not work at all, and will likely need a plugin replacement for GX+. If your feature was just isolated in a single function, or is super easy to migrate to GX+, we will be happy to do that free of charge. Complicated features will require a commission.   warning With GX+, ALL lights besides the StepWell & Marker lights are transparency based, instead of material based. This means, those lights, such as warning lights and turn signals, will need to have a duplicate part slightly offset, that should be named something like "Backing" with Transparency set to 0, and the Material set to SmoothPlastic. The light itself should have Transparency set to 1, and the Material set to Neon. The GX+ Migration Plugin does not do this for you since we aren't sure how your lights were previously setup if you did any modifications.   note Still need support? There's a support channel in our discord server. Have any suggestions or bugs to report? You can do that in our discord server too.

searchDocs.title: Type Support w/ luau​
searchDocs.content: Plugins (and the BusConfiguration for that matter) use the luau type system. This means that you can use types to help with auto-complete and error checking.   This basically tells you what you can put for a certain option/property, and it will tell you if you put something wrong.

searchDocs.title: DEBUGGING_ON​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable warnings/errors that GX+ encounters. This is useful for debugging issues with GX+ and can help you figure out what's going wrong.   Certain warnings, such as a warning for a new update, will be displayed regardless of this configuration option.

searchDocs.title: Lights​
searchDocs.content: Lights have a number of configuration options that can be used to customize their appearance and behavior.

searchDocs.title: AutoMarkerLights​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable automatically turning on marker lights when the bus is on, and turning them off when the bus is off.

searchDocs.title: BeamsType​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to switch between Dual and Quad beams.

searchDocs.title: WigWags​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable wigwags on the bus.

searchDocs.title: BrakeTaillight​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the brake taillight on the bus.

searchDocs.title: InteriorDomeLights​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the interior dome lights on the bus.

searchDocs.title: InteriorLightMonitor​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the interior light monitor on the bus.

searchDocs.title: StepWellLight​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the step well light on the bus.

searchDocs.title: Foglight​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the fog light on the bus.

searchDocs.title: LicensePlateLight​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the license plate light on the bus.

searchDocs.title: AutoTurnSignals​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable automatically turning off turn signals when the bus completed a turn, similar to most vehicles.

searchDocs.title: LightTypes​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to select the "type" of the light, which can be Incandescent, LED, or Strobing LED (only available for warning lights)   You can apply this to the following lights:   HeadlightTurnSignalsBrakeLightsReverseLightsInteriorLightsWarningLightsStopSignLights

searchDocs.title: Sounds​
searchDocs.content: Sounds have a number of configuration options that can be used to customize their behavior.

searchDocs.title: StartupRadio​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the startup radio sound.

searchDocs.title: BlinkerNoises​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the turn signal blinker noises.

searchDocs.title: WLNoises​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the warning light blinking noises, more commonly found on older buses.

searchDocs.title: BrakingSound​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the braking sound when the bus is braking (slowing down).

searchDocs.title: Timings​
searchDocs.content: Timings have a number of configuration options that can be used to customize the timings of certain actions.

searchDocs.title: WaitToStartMin​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the minimum amount of time the bus will wait before starting.

searchDocs.title: WaitToStartMax​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the maximum amount of time the bus will wait before starting.

searchDocs.title: StartupRadioDelay​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the delay before the startup radio sound plays.

searchDocs.title: TurnSignalSpeed​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the speed of the turn signals.

searchDocs.title: RedsOnDelay​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the delay before the reds turn on.

searchDocs.title: RedsOffDelay​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the delay before the reds turn off.

searchDocs.title: StopSignOnDelay​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the delay before the stop sign turns on.

searchDocs.title: StopSignOffDelay​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the delay before the stop sign turns off.

searchDocs.title: CrossingArmOnDelay​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the delay before the crossing arm turns on.

searchDocs.title: CrossingArmOffDelay​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the delay before the crossing arm turns off.

searchDocs.title: Fuel​
searchDocs.content: Fuel has a number of configuration options that can be used to customize the behavior of the fuel system.

searchDocs.title: FuelEnabled​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the fuel system.

searchDocs.title: FuelType​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the type of fuel the bus uses.

searchDocs.title: MaxFuelCapacity​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the maximum fuel capacity of the bus.

searchDocs.title: RandomFuelEnabled​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable starting the bus out with a random value of fuel.

searchDocs.title: RandomFuelMinimum​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the minimum amount of fuel the bus can have when random fuel is enabled.

searchDocs.title: RunningFuelDrain​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the amount of fuel the bus drains while running.

searchDocs.title: IdleFuelDrain​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the amount of fuel the bus drains while idling.

searchDocs.title: Text​
searchDocs.content: Text has a number of configuration options that can be used to customize the text on the bus.

searchDocs.title: AutoNumbering​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable automatically numbering the bus.

searchDocs.title: AutoLicensePlate​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable automatically generating a license plate for the bus.

searchDocs.title: LicensePlateFormat​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the format of the license plate.

searchDocs.title: LicensePlateMax​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the maximum random license plate number.

searchDocs.title: LicensePlateMin​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the minimum random license plate number.

searchDocs.title: Group​
searchDocs.content: Group has a number of configuration options that can be used to restrict access to the bus.

searchDocs.title: GroupCheckEnabled​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the group check.

searchDocs.title: GroupID​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the group ID of the bus.

searchDocs.title: MinimumDrivingRank​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the minimum driving rank of the bus.

searchDocs.title: Misc​
searchDocs.content: Misceallaneous configuration options.

searchDocs.title: DualStopSign​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable a second stop sign on the bus.

searchDocs.title: CrossingArm​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the crossing arm on the bus.

searchDocs.title: LeftServiceDoorAngle​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the angle of the left service door when .

searchDocs.title: RightServiceDoorAngle​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to set the angle of the right service door.

searchDocs.title: EngineStayOn​
searchDocs.content: This configuration option is used to enable/disable the engine staying on when the player exits the bus.

searchDocs.title: Controls​
searchDocs.content: Controls have 2 sub configuration options that can be used to customize the controls of the bus:   KeyboardController   There, you can customize the controls of the bus to your liking.
